translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'khor gyi khyams gnas gtsang ma'i steng nam mkha'i dkyil na gnas pa rin po che sna bdun gyis rab tu rnam par phye bar spras pa na byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs grangs med pa dang thabs cig tu bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'khor gyi khyams gnas gtsang ma'i steng nam mkha'i dkyil na gnas pa rin po che sna bdun gyis rab tu rnam par phye bar spras pa na byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs grangs med pa dang thabs cig tu bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in the Pure Abodes, in the sky above the Jeta Grove, in a pavilion adorned with the seven precious substances, together with an assembly of countless bodhisattvas.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: At that time, the Blessed One said to the bodhisattvas:

analyzed: khyed kyis 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir sgo drug pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs zungs shig /
translated: for the sake of benefiting and bringing happiness to all beings, you should uphold the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« called 'The Six Gates.'

original: de ni / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni / 'di lta ste /

original: 'khor ba nas 'khor ba'i skye gnas gzhan dag tu bdag gis sdug bsngal gang ci myong ba de /
analyzed: 'khor ba nas 'khor ba'i skye gnas gzhan dag tu bdag gis sdug bsngal gang ci myong ba de /
translated: Whatever suffering I have experienced in the various states of existence in samsara,

original: sems can thams cad dang mnyam nyid mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang mnyam nyid mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur cig /
translated: may it not be the characteristic of ignorance, which is shared by all sentient beings.

original: bdag gis 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i bde ba gang ci myong ba de /
analyzed: bdag gis 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i bde ba gang ci myong ba de /
translated: Whatever worldly perfect happiness I have experienced,

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du yongs su shes par byed par spyod par gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du yongs su shes par byed par spyod par gyur cig /
translated: may it be shared by all sentient beings.

original: bdag gis sdig pa mi dge ba'i @464b las gang ci byas pa de /
analyzed: bdag gis sdig pa mi dge ba'i @464b las gang ci byas pa de /
translated: Whatever nonvirtuous actions I have committed,

original: so sor bshags pa bla na med pas so sor ma bshags par ma gyur cig /
analyzed: so sor bshags pa bla na med pas so sor ma bshags par ma gyur cig /
translated: may they not be unconfessed actions, through the unsurpassed confession.

original: bdag gis bdud kyi las gang ci byas pa de /
analyzed: bdag gis bdud kyi las gang ci byas pa de /
translated: Whatever actions of Mara I have committed,

original: yongs su byed pa bla na med pas yongs su mi shes par ma gyur cig /
analyzed: yongs su byed pa bla na med pas yongs su mi shes par ma gyur cig /
translated: may they not be unknown through the unsurpassed performance.

original: bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang rung gang ci yod pa de thams cad bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi 'bras bur gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag gis pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang rung gang ci yod pa de thams cad bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi 'bras bur gyur cig /
translated: May all the roots of virtue that I have gathered through the practice of the perfections, whether mundane or supramundane, be the cause for the attainment of unexcelled wisdom.

original: bdag gi rnam par grol ba gang ci yod pa des sems can thams cad rnam par thar par gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag gi rnam par grol ba gang ci yod pa des sems can thams cad rnam par thar par gyur cig /
translated: May the liberation that I have attained be the cause for the liberation of all sentient beings.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas par ma gyur cig /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas par ma gyur cig /
translated: May they never abide in either samsara or nirvana.
